title: DireWolfM14
author: DireWolfM14
content: This guy is a loose cannon looking for a sucker. Â User LDU QUITO is very likely the well known scammer Humbertin, who's known to use many alts.First, he's asking for a $75 loan in a locked thread!?Quote from: LDU QUITO on July 25, 2022, 01:32:31 AMLoan Amount: 75 UsdtLoan Purpose: PersonalLoan Repay Amount: 85 UsdtLoan Repay Date: July 27Type of Collateral: BTCTRC20 - USDT address: TVnrLpPkvyNGCuWLAx3K6nDbtp3vUayzp7But, he also claims to have bitcoin for sale;Quote from: LDU QUITO on July 31, 2022, 05:37:57 AMI buy Paypal , Skrill , Neteller , Perfect Money and I Pay btc and usdtLimits $50 to $400Tg @Comer000Obviously something isn't adding up. Â He also sent me a loan request on Telegram, here's the zip file of the chat export;https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nBiHZqjrcEHkGK4NWnw0u57Zj5FZkNjH/view?usp=sharingCode:-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----------END PGP SIGNATURE-----And, here's a screenshot posted by a newbie who allegedly got scammed, where he's using the Telegram handle HumberRoll.Quote from: sheysilva on April 14, 2022, 08:11:30 AM~Known Telegram accounts:Code:@HumberRoll@Comer000He's also using a Telegram account with a hidden username:ETA: newbie flag created: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=3016

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: I don't know very well how the loans work in the forum, but I know a little bit more each time. Quote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 04:22:31 AMFirst, he's asking for a $75 loan in a locked thread!?Quote from: LDU QUITO on July 25, 2022, 01:32:31 AMLoan Amount: 75 UsdtLoan Purpose: PersonalLoan Repay Amount: 85 UsdtLoan Repay Date: July 27Type of Collateral: BTCTRC20 - USDT address: TVnrLpPkvyNGCuWLAx3K6nDbtp3vUayzp7The thread is locked and that doesn't bode well, I agree, but he is offering collateral. Isn't collateral a guarantee that he won't scam you? If he doesn't pay back the loan, you liquidate the collateral. Isn't that right?

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Poker Player on August 03, 2022, 04:54:17 AMThe thread is locked and that doesn't bode well, I agree, but he is offering collateral. Isn't collateral a guarantee that he won't scam you? If he doesn't pay back the loan, you liquidate the collateral. Isn't that right?He doesn't have any collateral, he never did.Â  I noticed that thread shortly after it was posted, it was locked from the start.Â  But it comes with a really tiny violine and sob story; the poor guy got scammed for his collateral:

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 04:22:31 AMCode:-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----------END PGP SIGNATURE-----What do we do with the code?The google URL is asking for permission. Is it possible to change the permission setting? Quote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 04:22:31 AMHe's also using a Telegram account with a hidden username:This is very common for telegram users.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.created_time: August 03, 2022, 05:15:15 AMLast edit: August 03, 2022, 05:25:44 AM by DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on August 03, 2022, 05:09:01 AMQuote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 04:22:31 AM~What do we do with the code?It's a GPG signature for the zip file. Â It's digital proof that the person who controls this GPG key claims ownership of that file. Â And it's dated and encrypted to the file, which means if the file is changed the signature won't match.Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on August 03, 2022, 05:09:01 AMThe google URL is asking for permission. Is it possible to change the permission setting?Done, sorry 'bout that.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 04:22:31 AMThis guy is a loose cannon looking for a sucker. Â Oh god! He's the guy with the binance accounts sale Â that went wrong, now that I think about probably that's where two scammers met each other, and again 70$, seems like everything is going around these numbers.QuoteOk i interested tg @Iximversors899tg @Chris003hTg @Comer000tg hermxita84Tg @Connorwattstelegram @HumberRolltelegram multu483TELEGRAM Â DIAXIQ81TG Fern3832telegram CambiodivisasLocalcryptoDefinitely not suspicious...

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 04:22:31 AMETA: newbie flag created: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=3016Flag supported.Definitely looks like an alt account of serial scammer Humbertin / HumberRoll / DavidXXXX and others (dozens of his alt accounts have already been identified), which means he's also ban evading.Quote from: LDU QUITO on April 11, 2022, 06:50:44 AMContact me telegram @HumberRoll

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 05:15:15 AMIt's a GPG signature for the zip file. Â It's digital proof that the person who controls this GPG key claims ownership of that file. Â And it's dated and encrypted to the file, which means if the file is changed the signature won't match.I know how it works but since I was not able to access the link, I did not know the reason for the key. All looks good now ðŸ˜‰Flag supported and left a negative feedback for the user too.Good job in connecting him.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on August 03, 2022, 04:22:31 AMHe's also using a Telegram account with a hidden username:Not for nothing, but that's pretty fucked up that telegram allows that.Â  I suppose it's no different than anonymous e-mails, but giving people the ability to send consequence-free spam and scam-phishing-stuff just paints telegram's reputation with a nice, thick coating of shit over the other layers it already has.Don't know if this dude is Humbertin or not, but it wouldn't surprise me given how active he was and likely still is.Â  When you've found your territory to scam in successfully, it's hard to give that up I'd think.Good job sussing out this flaming bag of ass, DireWolfM14.Â  May he be impaled on his own spear.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on August 04, 2022, 02:02:56 AMNot for nothing, but that's pretty fucked up that telegram allows that.Â It's pretty standard. I don't see it wrong. Everything has good and bad effect depending on how we are using it. I knife could be used to kill someone and the same knife we use in the kitchen. Telegram users can set a username if they want. In their privacy setting they can chose whether they want their number visible to others or not. Someone who is good man but concern about his privacy, for him it's a good choice. Exploiters will exploit everything.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.created_time: August 05, 2022, 10:20:25 AMLast edit: February 07, 2023, 12:23:48 PM by LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on August 04, 2022, 02:02:56 AMDon't know if this dude is Humbertin or notHe's not really trying to hide it:Quote from: LDU QUITO on April 11, 2022, 06:50:44 AMContact me telegram @HumberRollI've "known" Humbertin in my early days at Bitcoin, and he was an amazing character. Total gambling addict, I've seen him win 20 Bitcoin and lose it later again, and rain substantial amounts just to get attention. He cries just as hard when he loses cents as when he loses small fortunes.Also: I totally don't trust him.

comments.author: GxSTxV
comments.body: This scammer tried with me before also long time ago, and i made a warning against him in my thread when i was looking for a small trade, he is like a snake and looking always to catch someone to scam him. Glad he is tagged in red nowQuote from: GxSTxV on February 14, 2022, 03:10:24 PMQuote from: LDU QUITO on February 14, 2022, 03:01:54 PMQuote from: GxSTxV on February 14, 2022, 02:50:03 PMA newbie @LDU QUITO asking me to send first. Please stay away or you will get tagged for trying to scam meSo we use escrowHow could we trust you sorryYou didn't ask for an escrow you asked me to send btc to your walletAnd this is the link to my topic

comments.author: morvillz7z
comments.body: If LDU QUITO and PalermoMoon are connected to Humbertin, then those two (TheChin0s and MachineGam) might also be his alt accounts, connected via: Code:3NEabgbcpYWLV9QnGGcZPmUNEKSpYkPqNf1. LDU QUITO requests a refund to this address: Quote from: LDU QUITO on July 22, 2022, 07:55:53 AMMy goal is to request my refund for the purchase3NEabgbcpYWLV9QnGGcZPmUNEKSpYkPqNf2. PalermoMoon used the same address to enter a btc giveaway:Quote from: PalermoMoon on September 12, 2022, 04:13:33 PM3NEabgbcpYWLV9QnGGcZPmUNEKSpYkPqNfThank you3. TheChin0s used it also to participate in a giveaway (address was changed from 3NEabgbcpYWLV9QnGGcZPmUNEKSpYkPqNf to bc1qnn44lgfzmzl3kk68gccdke4z6vxgwju272nsss a week later). It's archived here.Quote from: TheChin0s on January 17, 2023, 10:19:47 AM3NEabgbcpYWLV9QnGGcZPmUNEKSpYkPqNfThanks!I hope it's seriously that contest4. MachineGam has used it multiple times to request a loan:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5436544.msg61645088#msg61645088Quote from: MachineGamLoan Amount: 0.001 BTCReason for Taking out a Loan: TradingAmount to be repaid:0.00115 btcRepayment Date: 27/01/2023Type of Collateral: LTCBitcoin Address: 3NEabgbcpYWLV9QnGGcZPmUNEKSpYkPqNfMaybe someone else can look into this before i tag both accounts, i see no other reason to use an address connected to a scammer unless that address is your own..., right?

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: If seen by user @LDU QUITO, the same thing has been done repeatedly here, with different Alt accounts, as evidenced by the name they use, namely: HumberRoll.Maybe, we can apply @LDU QUITO to the court (Ban evasion) for a ban.Reason: @LDU QUITO, also in violation (Ban evasion), probably reported him the best solution for now. although, some Alts are no longer active.Accounts Connected:1. HumberRoll (Archived)2. LDU QUITO3. HulkILoveYou4. FrancisDiceProof:Quote from: HumberRoll on August 09, 2017, 12:19:59 AMUsername HumberRollQuote from: LDU QUITO on April 14, 2022, 05:54:48 AMFJ username: HumberRollhttps://archive.vn/wip/28cMeQuote from: LDU QUITO on April 10, 2022, 04:23:47 PMTelegram @HumberRollhttps://archive.vn/wip/3R8IzQuote from: HulkILoveYou on August 26, 2021, 11:50:52 AMUsername HumberRollhttps://archive.vn/wip/RNpseLink October 11, 2017, 03:44:36 AM: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2256242.msg22836678#msg22836678QuoteUsername HumberRollQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM25. Ban evasion (using or creating accounts while one of your accounts is banned) is not allowed.[e]I hope the Mod, considering the evidence and case at hand, takes action against @LDU QUITO.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: morvillz7z on February 07, 2023, 12:16:59 PM~PalermoMoon certainly seems to have the Humbertin vibe.Â  I'm generally less inclined to be convinced by a misspelling, but there is the writing style, apparently native use of the Spanish language, and this tidbit below, which he's posted several times:Quote from: PalermoMoon on September 25, 2022, 08:14:38 PMUsername Hello I am HumbI'm not not sure I see enough to link TheChin0s just yet, but his behavior is rather odd and the writing style fits.Â  Other than him posting that address in the $50 give-away thread (then replacing it,) the only instance I could find of him posting that specific address is when he quoted MachineGam.Â  It's worth noting that in the $50 give-away thread he was the first to post after the OP.Â  Can't exactly claim he was quoting someone else, and forgot to edit the address.As for MachineGam, his writing style seems the same, also posts in Spanish, and the address does link him to PalermoMoon.Â  HIs behavior also seems odd; attempting to build trust by getting loans.None of this is really surprising, Humbertin has been farming alts for years now.
